law.catch_line: Cemetery And Crematory Corporations; Disclosure; Penalty
law.text: A cemetery corporation organized under this chapter or created by special act or charter shall disclose to its clients whether an owner, director or trustee of the cemetery corporation owns 10 per cent or more of a business that sells products or services to the cemetery corporation of which he is owner, director or trustee. The information shall be available for review by the public during the business hours of the cemetery at the cemeteryâ€™s place of business. Whoever violates this section shall be punished by a fine of $50 for each day of the violation.
